00062 
00063 #ifdef HAVE_SERVER_SUPPORT
00064 # define LDLM_MAX_GROWN_EXTENT (32 * 1024 * 1024 - 1)
00065 
00073 static void ldlm_extent_internal_policy_fixup(struct ldlm_lock *req,
00074                                               struct ldlm_extent *new_ex,
00075                                               int conflicting)
00076 {
00077         enum ldlm_mode req_mode = req->l_req_mode;
00078         __u64 req_start = req->l_req_extent.start;
00079         __u64 req_end = req->l_req_extent.end;
00080         __u64 req_align, mask;
00081 
00082         if (conflicting > 32 && (req_mode == LCK_PW || req_mode == LCK_CW)) {
00083                 if (req_end < req_start + LDLM_MAX_GROWN_EXTENT)
00084                         new_ex->end = min(req_start + LDLM_MAX_GROWN_EXTENT,
00085                                           new_ex->end);
00086         }
00087 
00088         if (new_ex->start == 0 && new_ex->end == OBD_OBJECT_EOF) {
00089                 EXIT;
00090                 return;
00091         }
00092 
00093         /* we need to ensure that the lock extent is properly aligned to what
00094          * the client requested. Also we need to make sure it's also server
00095          * page size aligned otherwise a server page can be covered by two
00096          * write locks. */
00097         mask = PAGE_CACHE_SIZE;
00098         req_align = (req_end + 1) | req_start;
00099         if (req_align != 0 && (req_align & (mask - 1)) == 0) {
00100                 while ((req_align & mask) == 0)
00101                         mask <<= 1;
00102         }
00103         mask -= 1;
00104         /* We can only shrink the lock, not grow it.
00105          * This should never cause lock to be smaller than requested,
00106          * since requested lock was already aligned on these boundaries. */
00107         new_ex->start = ((new_ex->start - 1) | mask) + 1;
00108         new_ex->end = ((new_ex->end + 1) & ~mask) - 1;
00109         LASSERTF(new_ex->start <= req_start,
00110                  "mask "LPX64" grant start "LPU64" req start "LPU64"\n",
00111                  mask, new_ex->start, req_start);
00112         LASSERTF(new_ex->end >= req_end,
00113                  "mask "LPX64" grant end "LPU64" req end "LPU64"\n",
00114                  mask, new_ex->end, req_end);
00115 }
00116 
00129 static void ldlm_extent_internal_policy_granted(struct ldlm_lock *req,
00130                                                 struct ldlm_extent *new_ex)
00131 {
00132         struct ldlm_resource *res = req->l_resource;
00133         enum ldlm_mode req_mode = req->l_req_mode;
00134         __u64 req_start = req->l_req_extent.start;
00135         __u64 req_end = req->l_req_extent.end;
00136         struct ldlm_interval_tree *tree;
00137         struct interval_node_extent limiter = { new_ex->start, new_ex->end };
00138         int conflicting = 0;
00139         int idx;
00140         ENTRY;
00141 
00142         lockmode_verify(req_mode);
00143 
00144         /* Using interval tree to handle the LDLM extent granted locks. */
00145         for (idx = 0; idx < LCK_MODE_NUM; idx++) {
00146                 struct interval_node_extent ext = { req_start, req_end };
00147 
00148                 tree = &res->lr_itree[idx];
00149                 if (lockmode_compat(tree->lit_mode, req_mode))
00150                         continue;
00151 
00152                 conflicting += tree->lit_size;
00153                 if (conflicting > 4)
00154                         limiter.start = req_start;
00155 
00156                 if (interval_is_overlapped(tree->lit_root, &ext))
00157                         CDEBUG(D_INFO, 
00158                                "req_mode = %d, tree->lit_mode = %d, "
00159                                "tree->lit_size = %d\n",
00160                                req_mode, tree->lit_mode, tree->lit_size);
00161                 interval_expand(tree->lit_root, &ext, &limiter);
00162                 limiter.start = max(limiter.start, ext.start);
00163                 limiter.end = min(limiter.end, ext.end);
00164                 if (limiter.start == req_start && limiter.end == req_end)
00165                         break;
00166         }
00167 
00168         new_ex->start = limiter.start;
00169         new_ex->end = limiter.end;
00170         LASSERT(new_ex->start <= req_start);
00171         LASSERT(new_ex->end >= req_end);
00172 
00173         ldlm_extent_internal_policy_fixup(req, new_ex, conflicting);
00174         EXIT;
00175 }
00176 
00177 /* The purpose of this function is to return:
00178  * - the maximum extent
00179  * - containing the requested extent
00180  * - and not overlapping existing conflicting extents outside the requested one
00181  */
00182 static void
00183 ldlm_extent_internal_policy_waiting(struct ldlm_lock *req,
00184                                     struct ldlm_extent *new_ex)
00185 {
00186         struct ldlm_resource *res = req->l_resource;
00187         enum ldlm_mode req_mode = req->l_req_mode;
00188         __u64 req_start = req->l_req_extent.start;
00189         __u64 req_end = req->l_req_extent.end;
00190         struct ldlm_lock *lock;
00191         int conflicting = 0;
00192         ENTRY;
00193 
00194         lockmode_verify(req_mode);
00195 
00196         /* for waiting locks */
00197         list_for_each_entry(lock, &res->lr_waiting, l_res_link) {
00198                 struct ldlm_extent *l_extent = &lock->l_policy_data.l_extent;
00199 
00200                 /* We already hit the minimum requested size, search no more */
00201                 if (new_ex->start == req_start && new_ex->end == req_end) {
00202                         EXIT;
00203                         return;
00204                 }
00205 
00206                 /* Don't conflict with ourselves */
00207                 if (req == lock)
00208                         continue;
00209 
00210                 /* Locks are compatible, overlap doesn't matter */
00211                 /* Until bug 20 is fixed, try to avoid granting overlapping
00212                  * locks on one client (they take a long time to cancel) */
00213                 if (lockmode_compat(lock->l_req_mode, req_mode) &&
00214                     lock->l_export != req->l_export)
00215                         continue;
00216 
00217                 /* If this is a high-traffic lock, don't grow downwards at all
00218                  * or grow upwards too much */
00219                 ++conflicting;
00220                 if (conflicting > 4)
00221                         new_ex->start = req_start;
00222 
00223                 /* If lock doesn't overlap new_ex, skip it. */
00224                 if (!ldlm_extent_overlap(l_extent, new_ex))
00225                         continue;
00226 
00227                 /* Locks conflicting in requested extents and we can't satisfy
00228                  * both locks, so ignore it.  Either we will ping-pong this
00229                  * extent (we would regardless of what extent we granted) or
00230                  * lock is unused and it shouldn't limit our extent growth. */
00231                 if (ldlm_extent_overlap(&lock->l_req_extent,&req->l_req_extent))
00232                         continue;
00233 
00234                 /* We grow extents downwards only as far as they don't overlap
00235                  * with already-granted locks, on the assumption that clients
00236                  * will be writing beyond the initial requested end and would
00237                  * then need to enqueue a new lock beyond previous request.
00238                  * l_req_extent->end strictly < req_start, checked above. */
00239                 if (l_extent->start < req_start && new_ex->start != req_start) {
00240                         if (l_extent->end >= req_start)
00241                                 new_ex->start = req_start;
00242                         else
00243                                 new_ex->start = min(l_extent->end+1, req_start);
00244                 }
00245 
00246                 /* If we need to cancel this lock anyways because our request
00247                  * overlaps the granted lock, we grow up to its requested
00248                  * extent start instead of limiting this extent, assuming that
00249                  * clients are writing forwards and the lock had over grown
00250                  * its extent downwards before we enqueued our request. */
00251                 if (l_extent->end > req_end) {
00252                         if (l_extent->start <= req_end)
00253                                 new_ex->end = max(lock->l_req_extent.start - 1,
00254                                                   req_end);
00255                         else
00256                                 new_ex->end = max(l_extent->start - 1, req_end);
00257                 }
00258         }
00259 
00260         ldlm_extent_internal_policy_fixup(req, new_ex, conflicting);
00261         EXIT;
00262 }
00263 
00264 
00265 /* In order to determine the largest possible extent we can grant, we need
00266  * to scan all of the queues. */
00267 static void ldlm_extent_policy(struct ldlm_resource *res,
00268                                struct ldlm_lock *lock, __u64 *flags)
00269 {
00270         struct ldlm_extent new_ex = { .start = 0, .end = OBD_OBJECT_EOF };
00271 
00272         if (lock->l_export == NULL)
00273                 /*
00274                  * this is local lock taken by server (e.g., as a part of
00275                  * OST-side locking, or unlink handling). Expansion doesn't
00276                  * make a lot of sense for local locks, because they are
00277                  * dropped immediately on operation completion and would only
00278                  * conflict with other threads.
00279                  */
00280                 return;
00281 
00282         if (lock->l_policy_data.l_extent.start == 0 &&
00283             lock->l_policy_data.l_extent.end == OBD_OBJECT_EOF)
00284                 /* fast-path whole file locks */
00285                 return;
00286 
00287         ldlm_extent_internal_policy_granted(lock, &new_ex);
00288         ldlm_extent_internal_policy_waiting(lock, &new_ex);
00289 
00290         if (new_ex.start != lock->l_policy_data.l_extent.start ||
00291             new_ex.end != lock->l_policy_data.l_extent.end) {
00292                 *flags |= LDLM_FL_LOCK_CHANGED;
00293                 lock->l_policy_data.l_extent.start = new_ex.start;
00294                 lock->l_policy_data.l_extent.end = new_ex.end;
00295         }
00296 }
00297 
00298 static int ldlm_check_contention(struct ldlm_lock *lock, int contended_locks)
00299 {
00300         struct ldlm_resource *res = lock->l_resource;
00301         cfs_time_t now = cfs_time_current();
00302 
00303         if (OBD_FAIL_CHECK(OBD_FAIL_LDLM_SET_CONTENTION))
00304                 return 1;
00305 
00306         CDEBUG(D_DLMTRACE, "contended locks = %d\n", contended_locks);
00307         if (contended_locks > ldlm_res_to_ns(res)->ns_contended_locks)
00308                 res->lr_contention_time = now;
00309         return cfs_time_before(now, cfs_time_add(res->lr_contention_time,
00310                 cfs_time_seconds(ldlm_res_to_ns(res)->ns_contention_time)));
00311 }
00312 
00313 struct ldlm_extent_compat_args {
00314         struct list_head *work_list;
00315         struct ldlm_lock *lock;
00316         enum ldlm_mode mode;
00317         int *locks;
00318         int *compat;
00319 };
00320 
00321 static enum interval_iter ldlm_extent_compat_cb(struct interval_node *n,
00322                                                 void *data)
00323 {
00324         struct ldlm_extent_compat_args *priv = data;
00325         struct ldlm_interval *node = to_ldlm_interval(n);
00326         struct ldlm_extent *extent;
00327         struct list_head *work_list = priv->work_list;
00328         struct ldlm_lock *lock, *enq = priv->lock;
00329         enum ldlm_mode mode = priv->mode;
00330         int count = 0;
00331         ENTRY;
00332 
00333         LASSERT(!list_empty(&node->li_group));
00334 
00335         list_for_each_entry(lock, &node->li_group, l_sl_policy) {
00336                 /* interval tree is for granted lock */
00337                 LASSERTF(mode == lock->l_granted_mode,
00338                          "mode = %s, lock->l_granted_mode = %s\n",
00339                          ldlm_lockname[mode],
00340                          ldlm_lockname[lock->l_granted_mode]);
00341                 count++;
00342                 if (lock->l_blocking_ast &&
00343                     lock->l_granted_mode != LCK_GROUP)
00344                         ldlm_add_ast_work_item(lock, enq, work_list);
00345         }
00346 
00347         /* don't count conflicting glimpse locks */
00348         extent = ldlm_interval_extent(node);
00349         if (!(mode == LCK_PR &&
00350             extent->start == 0 && extent->end == OBD_OBJECT_EOF))
00351                 *priv->locks += count;
00352 
00353         if (priv->compat)
00354                 *priv->compat = 0;
00355 
00356         RETURN(INTERVAL_ITER_CONT);
00357 }
00358 
00371 static int
00372 ldlm_extent_compat_queue(struct list_head *queue, struct ldlm_lock *req,
00373                          __u64 *flags, enum ldlm_error *err,
00374                          struct list_head *work_list, int *contended_locks)
00375 {
00376         struct ldlm_resource *res = req->l_resource;
00377         enum ldlm_mode req_mode = req->l_req_mode;
00378         __u64 req_start = req->l_req_extent.start;
00379         __u64 req_end = req->l_req_extent.end;
00380         struct ldlm_lock *lock;
00381         int check_contention;
00382         int compat = 1;
00383         int scan = 0;
00384         ENTRY;
00385 
00386         lockmode_verify(req_mode);
00387 
00388         /* Using interval tree for granted lock */
00389         if (queue == &res->lr_granted) {
00390                 struct ldlm_interval_tree *tree;
00391                 struct ldlm_extent_compat_args data = {.work_list = work_list,
00392                                                .lock = req,
00393                                                .locks = contended_locks,
00394                                                .compat = &compat };
00395                 struct interval_node_extent ex = { .start = req_start,
00396                                                    .end = req_end };
00397                 int idx, rc;
00398 
00399                 for (idx = 0; idx < LCK_MODE_NUM; idx++) {
00400                         tree = &res->lr_itree[idx];
00401                         if (tree->lit_root == NULL) /* empty tree, skipped */
00402                                 continue;
00403 
00404                         data.mode = tree->lit_mode;
00405                         if (lockmode_compat(req_mode, tree->lit_mode)) {
00406                                 struct ldlm_interval *node;
00407                                 struct ldlm_extent *extent;
00408 
00409                                 if (req_mode != LCK_GROUP)
00410                                         continue;
00411 
00412                                 /* group lock, grant it immediately if
00413                                  * compatible */
00414                                 node = to_ldlm_interval(tree->lit_root);
00415                                 extent = ldlm_interval_extent(node);
00416                                 if (req->l_policy_data.l_extent.gid ==
00417                                     extent->gid)
00418                                         RETURN(2);
00419                         }
00420 
00421                         if (tree->lit_mode == LCK_GROUP) {
00422                                 if (*flags & LDLM_FL_BLOCK_NOWAIT) {
00423                                         compat = -EWOULDBLOCK;
00424                                         goto destroylock;
00425                                 }
00426 
00427                                 *flags |= LDLM_FL_NO_TIMEOUT;
00428                                 if (!work_list)
00429                                         RETURN(0);
00430 
00431                                 /* if work list is not NULL,add all
00432                                    locks in the tree to work list */
00433                                 compat = 0;
00434                                 interval_iterate(tree->lit_root,
00435                                                  ldlm_extent_compat_cb, &data);
00436                                 continue;
00437                         }
00438 
00439                         if (!work_list) {
00440                                 rc = interval_is_overlapped(tree->lit_root,&ex);
00441                                 if (rc)
00442                                         RETURN(0);
00443                         } else {
00444                                 interval_search(tree->lit_root, &ex,
00445                                                 ldlm_extent_compat_cb, &data);
00446                                 if (!list_empty(work_list) && compat)
00447                                         compat = 0;
00448                         }
00449                 }
00450         } else { /* for waiting queue */
00451                 list_for_each_entry(lock, queue, l_res_link) {
00452                         check_contention = 1;
00453 
00454                         /* We stop walking the queue if we hit ourselves so
00455                          * we don't take conflicting locks enqueued after us
00456                          * into account, or we'd wait forever. */
00457                         if (req == lock)
00458                                 break;
00459 
00460                         if (unlikely(scan)) {
00461                                 /* We only get here if we are queuing GROUP lock
00462                                    and met some incompatible one. The main idea of this
00463                                    code is to insert GROUP lock past compatible GROUP
00464                                    lock in the waiting queue or if there is not any,
00465                                    then in front of first non-GROUP lock */
00466                                 if (lock->l_req_mode != LCK_GROUP) {
00467                                         /* Ok, we hit non-GROUP lock, there should
00468                                          * be no more GROUP locks later on, queue in
00469                                          * front of first non-GROUP lock */
00470 
00471                                         ldlm_resource_insert_lock_after(lock, req);
00472                                         list_del_init(&lock->l_res_link);
00473                                         ldlm_resource_insert_lock_after(req, lock);
00474                                         compat = 0;
00475                                         break;
00476                                 }
00477                                 if (req->l_policy_data.l_extent.gid ==
00478                                     lock->l_policy_data.l_extent.gid) {
00479                                         /* found it */
00480                                         ldlm_resource_insert_lock_after(lock, req);
00481                                         compat = 0;
00482                                         break;
00483                                 }
00484                                 continue;
00485                         }
00486 
00487                         /* locks are compatible, overlap doesn't matter */
00488                         if (lockmode_compat(lock->l_req_mode, req_mode)) {
00489                                 if (req_mode == LCK_PR &&
00490                                     ((lock->l_policy_data.l_extent.start <=
00491                                       req->l_policy_data.l_extent.start) &&
00492                                      (lock->l_policy_data.l_extent.end >=
00493                                       req->l_policy_data.l_extent.end))) {
00494                                         /* If we met a PR lock just like us or
00495                                            wider, and nobody down the list
00496                                            conflicted with it, that means we
00497                                            can skip processing of the rest of
00498                                            the list and safely place ourselves
00499                                            at the end of the list, or grant
00500                                            (dependent if we met an conflicting
00501                                            locks before in the list).  In case
00502                                            of 1st enqueue only we continue
00503                                            traversing if there is something
00504                                            conflicting down the list because
00505                                            we need to make sure that something
00506                                            is marked as AST_SENT as well, in
00507                                            cse of empy worklist we would exit
00508                                            on first conflict met. */
00509                                         /* There IS a case where such flag is
00510                                            not set for a lock, yet it blocks
00511                                            something. Luckily for us this is
00512                                            only during destroy, so lock is
00513                                            exclusive. So here we are safe */
00514                                         if (!ldlm_is_ast_sent(lock))
00515                                                 RETURN(compat);
00516                                 }
00517 
00518                                 /* non-group locks are compatible, overlap doesn't
00519                                    matter */
00520                                 if (likely(req_mode != LCK_GROUP))
00521                                         continue;
00522 
00523                                 /* If we are trying to get a GROUP lock and there is
00524                                    another one of this kind, we need to compare gid */
00525                                 if (req->l_policy_data.l_extent.gid ==
00526                                     lock->l_policy_data.l_extent.gid) {
00527                                         /* If existing lock with matched gid is granted,
00528                                            we grant new one too. */
00529                                         if (lock->l_req_mode == lock->l_granted_mode)
00530                                                 RETURN(2);
00531 
00532                                         /* Otherwise we are scanning queue of waiting
00533                                          * locks and it means current request would
00534                                          * block along with existing lock (that is
00535                                          * already blocked.
00536                                          * If we are in nonblocking mode - return
00537                                          * immediately */
00538                                         if (*flags & LDLM_FL_BLOCK_NOWAIT) {
00539                                                 compat = -EWOULDBLOCK;
00540                                                 goto destroylock;
00541                                         }
00542                                         /* If this group lock is compatible with another
00543                                          * group lock on the waiting list, they must be
00544                                          * together in the list, so they can be granted
00545                                          * at the same time.  Otherwise the later lock
00546                                          * can get stuck behind another, incompatible,
00547                                          * lock. */
00548                                         ldlm_resource_insert_lock_after(lock, req);
00549                                         /* Because 'lock' is not granted, we can stop
00550                                          * processing this queue and return immediately.
00551                                          * There is no need to check the rest of the
00552                                          * list. */
00553                                         RETURN(0);
00554                                 }
00555                         }
00556 
00557                         if (unlikely(req_mode == LCK_GROUP &&
00558                                      (lock->l_req_mode != lock->l_granted_mode))) {
00559                                 scan = 1;
00560                                 compat = 0;
00561                                 if (lock->l_req_mode != LCK_GROUP) {
00562                                         /* Ok, we hit non-GROUP lock, there should be no
00563                                            more GROUP locks later on, queue in front of
00564                                            first non-GROUP lock */
00565 
00566                                         ldlm_resource_insert_lock_after(lock, req);
00567                                         list_del_init(&lock->l_res_link);
00568                                         ldlm_resource_insert_lock_after(req, lock);
00569                                         break;
00570                                 }
00571                                 if (req->l_policy_data.l_extent.gid ==
00572                                     lock->l_policy_data.l_extent.gid) {
00573                                         /* found it */
00574                                         ldlm_resource_insert_lock_after(lock, req);
00575                                         break;
00576                                 }
00577                                 continue;
00578                         }
00579 
00580                         if (unlikely(lock->l_req_mode == LCK_GROUP)) {
00581                                 /* If compared lock is GROUP, then requested is PR/PW/
00582                                  * so this is not compatible; extent range does not
00583                                  * matter */
00584                                 if (*flags & LDLM_FL_BLOCK_NOWAIT) {
00585                                         compat = -EWOULDBLOCK;
00586                                         goto destroylock;
00587                                 } else {
00588                                         *flags |= LDLM_FL_NO_TIMEOUT;
00589                                 }
00590                         } else if (lock->l_policy_data.l_extent.end < req_start ||
00591                                    lock->l_policy_data.l_extent.start > req_end) {
00592                                 /* if a non group lock doesn't overlap skip it */
00593                                 continue;
00594                         } else if (lock->l_req_extent.end < req_start ||
00595                                    lock->l_req_extent.start > req_end) {
00596                                 /* false contention, the requests doesn't really overlap */
00597                                 check_contention = 0;
00598                         }
00599 
00600                         if (!work_list)
00601                                 RETURN(0);
00602 
00603                         /* don't count conflicting glimpse locks */
00604                         if (lock->l_req_mode == LCK_PR &&
00605                             lock->l_policy_data.l_extent.start == 0 &&
00606                             lock->l_policy_data.l_extent.end == OBD_OBJECT_EOF)
00607                                 check_contention = 0;
00608 
00609                         *contended_locks += check_contention;
00610 
00611                         compat = 0;
00612                         if (lock->l_blocking_ast &&
00613                             lock->l_req_mode != LCK_GROUP)
00614                                 ldlm_add_ast_work_item(lock, req, work_list);
00615                 }
00616         }
00617 
00618         if (ldlm_check_contention(req, *contended_locks) &&
00619             compat == 0 &&
00620             (*flags & LDLM_FL_DENY_ON_CONTENTION) &&
00621             req->l_req_mode != LCK_GROUP &&
00622             req_end - req_start <=
00623             ldlm_res_to_ns(req->l_resource)->ns_max_nolock_size)
00624                 GOTO(destroylock, compat = -EUSERS);
00625 
00626         RETURN(compat);
00627 destroylock:
00628         list_del_init(&req->l_res_link);
00629         ldlm_lock_destroy_nolock(req);
00630         *err = compat;
00631         RETURN(compat);
00632 }
00633 
00640 static void discard_bl_list(struct list_head *bl_list)
00641 {
00642         struct list_head *tmp, *pos;
00643         ENTRY;
00644 
00645         list_for_each_safe(pos, tmp, bl_list) {
00646                 struct ldlm_lock *lock =
00647                         list_entry(pos, struct ldlm_lock, l_bl_ast);
00648 
00649                 list_del_init(&lock->l_bl_ast);
00650                 LASSERT(ldlm_is_ast_sent(lock));
00651                 ldlm_clear_ast_sent(lock);
00652                 LASSERT(lock->l_bl_ast_run == 0);
00653                 LASSERT(lock->l_blocking_lock);
00654                 LDLM_LOCK_RELEASE(lock->l_blocking_lock);
00655                 lock->l_blocking_lock = NULL;
00656                 LDLM_LOCK_RELEASE(lock);
00657         }
00658         EXIT;
00659 }
00660 
00676 int ldlm_process_extent_lock(struct ldlm_lock *lock, __u64 *flags,
00677                              int first_enq, enum ldlm_error *err,
00678                              struct list_head *work_list)
00679 {
00680         struct ldlm_resource *res = lock->l_resource;
00681         struct list_head rpc_list;
00682         int rc, rc2;
00683         int contended_locks = 0;
00684         ENTRY;
00685 
00686         LASSERT(lock->l_granted_mode != lock->l_req_mode);
00687         LASSERT(list_empty(&res->lr_converting));
00688         LASSERT(!(*flags & LDLM_FL_DENY_ON_CONTENTION) ||
00689                 !ldlm_is_ast_discard_data(lock));
00690         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&rpc_list);
00691         check_res_locked(res);
00692         *err = ELDLM_OK;
00693 
00694         if (!first_enq) {
00695                 /* Careful observers will note that we don't handle -EWOULDBLOCK
00696                  * here, but it's ok for a non-obvious reason -- compat_queue
00697                  * can only return -EWOULDBLOCK if (flags & BLOCK_NOWAIT).
00698                  * flags should always be zero here, and if that ever stops
00699                  * being true, we want to find out. */
00700                 LASSERT(*flags == 0);
00701                 rc = ldlm_extent_compat_queue(&res->lr_granted, lock, flags,
00702                                               err, NULL, &contended_locks);
00703                 if (rc == 1) {
00704                         rc = ldlm_extent_compat_queue(&res->lr_waiting, lock,
00705                                                       flags, err, NULL,
00706                                                       &contended_locks);
00707                 }
00708                 if (rc == 0)
00709                         RETURN(LDLM_ITER_STOP);
00710 
00711                 ldlm_resource_unlink_lock(lock);
00712 
00713                 if (!OBD_FAIL_CHECK(OBD_FAIL_LDLM_CANCEL_EVICT_RACE))
00714                         ldlm_extent_policy(res, lock, flags);
00715                 ldlm_grant_lock(lock, work_list);
00716                 RETURN(LDLM_ITER_CONTINUE);
00717         }
00718 
00719  restart:
00720         contended_locks = 0;
00721         rc = ldlm_extent_compat_queue(&res->lr_granted, lock, flags, err,
00722                                       &rpc_list, &contended_locks);
00723         if (rc < 0)
00724                 GOTO(out, rc); /* lock was destroyed */
00725         if (rc == 2)
00726                 goto grant;
00727 
00728         rc2 = ldlm_extent_compat_queue(&res->lr_waiting, lock, flags, err,
00729                                        &rpc_list, &contended_locks);
00730         if (rc2 < 0)
00731                 GOTO(out, rc = rc2); /* lock was destroyed */
00732 
00733         if (rc + rc2 == 2) {
00734         grant:
00735                 ldlm_extent_policy(res, lock, flags);
00736                 ldlm_resource_unlink_lock(lock);
00737                 ldlm_grant_lock(lock, NULL);
00738         } else {
00739                 /* If either of the compat_queue()s returned failure, then we
00740                  * have ASTs to send and must go onto the waiting list.
00741                  *
00742                  * bug 2322: we used to unlink and re-add here, which was a
00743                  * terrible folly -- if we goto restart, we could get
00744                  * re-ordered!  Causes deadlock, because ASTs aren't sent! */
00745                 if (list_empty(&lock->l_res_link))
00746                         ldlm_resource_add_lock(res, &res->lr_waiting, lock);
00747                 unlock_res(res);
00748                 rc = ldlm_run_ast_work(ldlm_res_to_ns(res), &rpc_list,
00749                                        LDLM_WORK_BL_AST);
00750 
00751                 if (OBD_FAIL_CHECK(OBD_FAIL_LDLM_OST_FAIL_RACE) &&
00752                     !ns_is_client(ldlm_res_to_ns(res)))
00753                         class_fail_export(lock->l_export);
00754 
00755                 lock_res(res);
00756                 if (rc == -ERESTART) {
00757                         /* 15715: The lock was granted and destroyed after
00758                          * resource lock was dropped. Interval node was freed
00759                          * in ldlm_lock_destroy. Anyway, this always happens
00760                          * when a client is being evicted. So it would be
00761                          * ok to return an error. -jay */
00762                         if (ldlm_is_destroyed(lock)) {
00763                                 *err = -EAGAIN;
00764                                 GOTO(out, rc = -EAGAIN);
00765                         }
00766 
00767                         /* lock was granted while resource was unlocked. */
00768                         if (lock->l_granted_mode == lock->l_req_mode) {
00769                                 /* bug 11300: if the lock has been granted,
00770                                  * break earlier because otherwise, we will go
00771                                  * to restart and ldlm_resource_unlink will be
00772                                  * called and it causes the interval node to be
00773                                  * freed. Then we will fail at
00774                                  * ldlm_extent_add_lock() */
00775                                 *flags &= ~LDLM_FL_BLOCKED_MASK;
00776                                 GOTO(out, rc = 0);
00777                         }
00778 
00779                         GOTO(restart, rc);
00780                 }
00781 
00782                 /* this way we force client to wait for the lock
00783                  * endlessly once the lock is enqueued -bzzz */
00784                 *flags |= LDLM_FL_BLOCK_GRANTED | LDLM_FL_NO_TIMEOUT;
00785 
00786         }
00787         RETURN(0);
00788 out:
00789         if (!list_empty(&rpc_list)) {
00790                 LASSERT(!ldlm_is_ast_discard_data(lock));
00791                 discard_bl_list(&rpc_list);
00792         }
00793         RETURN(rc);
00794 }
00795 #endif /* HAVE_SERVER_SUPPORT */
00796 
00797 /* When a lock is cancelled by a client, the KMS may undergo change if this
00798  * is the "highest lock".  This function returns the new KMS value.
00799  * Caller must hold lr_lock already.
00800  *
00801  * NB: A lock on [x,y] protects a KMS of up to y + 1 bytes! */
00802 __u64 ldlm_extent_shift_kms(struct ldlm_lock *lock, __u64 old_kms)
00803 {
00804         struct ldlm_resource *res = lock->l_resource;
00805         struct list_head *tmp;
00806         struct ldlm_lock *lck;
00807         __u64 kms = 0;
00808         ENTRY;
00809 
00810         /* don't let another thread in ldlm_extent_shift_kms race in
00811          * just after we finish and take our lock into account in its
00812          * calculation of the kms */
00813         ldlm_set_kms_ignore(lock);
00814 
00815         list_for_each(tmp, &res->lr_granted) {
00816                 lck = list_entry(tmp, struct ldlm_lock, l_res_link);
00817 
00818                 if (ldlm_is_kms_ignore(lck))
00819                         continue;
00820 
00821                 if (lck->l_policy_data.l_extent.end >= old_kms)
00822                         RETURN(old_kms);
00823 
00824                 /* This extent _has_ to be smaller than old_kms (checked above)
00825                  * so kms can only ever be smaller or the same as old_kms. */
00826                 if (lck->l_policy_data.l_extent.end + 1 > kms)
00827                         kms = lck->l_policy_data.l_extent.end + 1;
00828         }
00829         LASSERTF(kms <= old_kms, "kms "LPU64" old_kms "LPU64"\n", kms, old_kms);
00830 
00831         RETURN(kms);
00832 }
00833 EXPORT_SYMBOL(ldlm_extent_shift_kms);
00834 
00835 struct kmem_cache *ldlm_interval_slab;
00836 struct ldlm_interval *ldlm_interval_alloc(struct ldlm_lock *lock)
00837 {
00838         struct ldlm_interval *node;
00839         ENTRY;
00840 
00841         LASSERT(lock->l_resource->lr_type == LDLM_EXTENT);
00842         OBD_SLAB_ALLOC_PTR_GFP(node, ldlm_interval_slab, GFP_NOFS);
00843         if (node == NULL)
00844                 RETURN(NULL);
00845 
00846         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&node->li_group);
00847         ldlm_interval_attach(node, lock);
00848         RETURN(node);
00849 }
00850 
00851 void ldlm_interval_free(struct ldlm_interval *node)
00852 {
00853         if (node) {
00854                 LASSERT(list_empty(&node->li_group));
00855                 LASSERT(!interval_is_intree(&node->li_node));
00856                 OBD_SLAB_FREE(node, ldlm_interval_slab, sizeof(*node));
00857         }
00858 }
00859 
00860 /* interval tree, for LDLM_EXTENT. */
00861 void ldlm_interval_attach(struct ldlm_interval *n,
00862                           struct ldlm_lock *l)
00863 {
00864         LASSERT(l->l_tree_node == NULL);
00865         LASSERT(l->l_resource->lr_type == LDLM_EXTENT);
00866 
00867         list_add_tail(&l->l_sl_policy, &n->li_group);
00868         l->l_tree_node = n;
00869 }
00870 
00871 struct ldlm_interval *ldlm_interval_detach(struct ldlm_lock *l)
00872 {
00873         struct ldlm_interval *n = l->l_tree_node;
00874 
00875         if (n == NULL)
00876                 return NULL;
00877 
00878         LASSERT(!list_empty(&n->li_group));
00879         l->l_tree_node = NULL;
00880         list_del_init(&l->l_sl_policy);
00881 
00882         return list_empty(&n->li_group) ? n : NULL;
00883 }
00884 
00885 static inline int ldlm_mode_to_index(enum ldlm_mode mode)
00886 {
00887         int index;
00888 
00889         LASSERT(mode != 0);
00890         LASSERT(IS_PO2(mode));
00891         for (index = -1; mode != 0; index++, mode >>= 1)
00892                 /* do nothing */;
00893         LASSERT(index < LCK_MODE_NUM);
00894         return index;
00895 }
00896 
00898 void ldlm_extent_add_lock(struct ldlm_resource *res,
00899                           struct ldlm_lock *lock)
00900 {
00901         struct interval_node *found, **root;
00902         struct ldlm_interval *node;
00903         struct ldlm_extent *extent;
00904         int idx;
00905 
00906         LASSERT(lock->l_granted_mode == lock->l_req_mode);
00907 
00908         node = lock->l_tree_node;
00909         LASSERT(node != NULL);
00910         LASSERT(!interval_is_intree(&node->li_node));
00911 
00912         idx = ldlm_mode_to_index(lock->l_granted_mode);
00913         LASSERT(lock->l_granted_mode == 1 << idx);
00914         LASSERT(lock->l_granted_mode == res->lr_itree[idx].lit_mode);
00915 
00916         /* node extent initialize */
00917         extent = &lock->l_policy_data.l_extent;
00918         interval_set(&node->li_node, extent->start, extent->end);
00919 
00920         root = &res->lr_itree[idx].lit_root;
00921         found = interval_insert(&node->li_node, root);
00922         if (found) { /* The policy group found. */
00923                 struct ldlm_interval *tmp = ldlm_interval_detach(lock);
00924                 LASSERT(tmp != NULL);
00925                 ldlm_interval_free(tmp);
00926                 ldlm_interval_attach(to_ldlm_interval(found), lock);
00927         }
00928         res->lr_itree[idx].lit_size++;
00929 
00930         /* even though we use interval tree to manage the extent lock, we also
00931          * add the locks into grant list, for debug purpose, .. */
00932         ldlm_resource_add_lock(res, &res->lr_granted, lock);
00933 }
00934 
00936 void ldlm_extent_unlink_lock(struct ldlm_lock *lock)
00937 {
00938         struct ldlm_resource *res = lock->l_resource;
00939         struct ldlm_interval *node = lock->l_tree_node;
00940         struct ldlm_interval_tree *tree;
00941         int idx;
00942 
00943         if (!node || !interval_is_intree(&node->li_node)) /* duplicate unlink */
00944                 return;
00945 
00946         idx = ldlm_mode_to_index(lock->l_granted_mode);
00947         LASSERT(lock->l_granted_mode == 1 << idx);
00948         tree = &res->lr_itree[idx];
00949 
00950         LASSERT(tree->lit_root != NULL); /* assure the tree is not null */
00951 
00952         tree->lit_size--;
00953         node = ldlm_interval_detach(lock);
00954         if (node) {
00955                 interval_erase(&node->li_node, &tree->lit_root);
00956                 ldlm_interval_free(node);
00957         }
00958 }
00959 
00960 void ldlm_extent_policy_wire_to_local(const union ldlm_wire_policy_data *wpolicy,
00961                                       union ldlm_policy_data *lpolicy)
00962 {
00963         memset(lpolicy, 0, sizeof(*lpolicy));
00964         lpolicy->l_extent.start = wpolicy->l_extent.start;
00965         lpolicy->l_extent.end = wpolicy->l_extent.end;
00966         lpolicy->l_extent.gid = wpolicy->l_extent.gid;
00967 }
00968 
00969 void ldlm_extent_policy_local_to_wire(const union ldlm_policy_data *lpolicy,
00970                                       union ldlm_wire_policy_data *wpolicy)
00971 {
00972         memset(wpolicy, 0, sizeof(*wpolicy));
00973         wpolicy->l_extent.start = lpolicy->l_extent.start;
00974         wpolicy->l_extent.end = lpolicy->l_extent.end;
00975         wpolicy->l_extent.gid = lpolicy->l_extent.gid;
00976 }
